Chapter 17, Part 2: The Ten Practices of the Bodhisattva of the Heap of Meritorious Virtues and Flowers
At that time, by the Buddha's spiritual power, the worlds in the ten directions shook in six ways. The TathÄgata's majestic spiritual power is like this:

It rained clouds of heavenly flowers, clouds of heavenly incense, clouds of heavenly powdered incense, clouds of heavenly garlands, clouds of heavenly garments, clouds of heavenly jewels, and clouds of heavenly adornments;

Just as in the Heaven of YÄma in the four continents, the Dharma of the ten practices was spoken. By the Buddha's spiritual power, it was also like this in the worlds in the ten directions.

At that time, from the ten directions, each from worlds surpassing ten times the number of dust particles in the Buddha-lands, bodhisattvas equal in number to the dust particles in ten thousand Buddha-lands, filling the ten directions, came to this land.
Having arrived, they said to Bodhisattva Forest of Merit:
Excellent!
Child of Buddha!
You are able to expound the practices of the bodhisattvas.
We bodhisattvas who have come here all have the same name, Forest of Merit;
Our worlds are all called Banner of Merit, and the Buddhas are all called Universal Merit.
In the abodes of those Buddhas, the ten practices are also being expounded, with the same names, flavors, and meanings, and the assemblies and retinues are also the same, neither more nor less.
Therefore, Child of Buddha!

We, by the spiritual power of the Buddha, have come to this land to bear witness for you. In the Jeta Grove of the royal capital, in the palace of the Heaven of YÄma, in the hall adorned with jewels, the ten practices are being expounded. We have come to bear witness. It is the same in the worlds of the ten directions.

At that time, the Bodhisattva Forest of Merit, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, universally contemplated the entire Dharma realm and all the retinues in the ten directions. He wished to cause the Buddha lineage to never be cut off, to cause the bodhisattva lineage to be pure, to cause the bodhisattva vows to not change, to cause the practice lineage to be unbroken, to cause the lineage of the Buddhas of the three times to be included and taken up, to cause the seeds of sentient beings' wholesome roots to be distinguished and explained, to cause the time, faculties, and mental inclinations of all sentient beings to be observed, to cause the seeds of the practices of the defiled and pure minds to be universally illuminated, and to cause the lineage of all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas to be universally illuminated. With a respectful mind, I bow my head to the Honored One of the ten powers, whose pure wisdom is free from defilement and unobstructed,
Whose realm is profound and far-reaching, without compare, and whose path is as pure as space.
The most supreme among humans, without obstruction, with immeasurable merits and no fear,

The countless and boundless stages, their wisdom penetrating without obstruction,

The Chapter on the Ten Inexhaustible Treasuries of the Bodhisattvas, from the MahÄvaipulya BuddhÃ¢vataá¹ƒsaka SÅ«tra, Chapter 18: The Ten Inexhaustible Treasuries of the Bodhisattvas At that time, Bodhisattva MahÄsattva Forest of Merit again said to the bodhisattvas:
Buddha's disciples!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have ten kinds of treasuries that are expounded by the buddhas of the three times.
What are the ten?

The treasury of faith, the treasury of precepts, the treasury of shame, the treasury of remorse, the treasury of hearing, the treasury of giving, the treasury of wisdom, the treasury of right mindfulness, the treasury of upholding, and the treasury of eloquence.
These are the ten.
What is the treasury of faith of the bodhisattva?

This bodhisattva has faith in all dharmas being empty and without true reality, has faith in all dharmas being signless, has faith in all dharmas being wishless, has faith in all dharmas being without an agent, has faith in all dharmas being unreal, has faith in all dharmas being without solidity, has faith in all dharmas being immeasurable, has faith in all dharmas being unsurpassed, has faith in all dharmas being uncrossable, and has faith in all dharmas being unborn.
If a bodhisattva accomplishes such pure faith in accordance with this, hearing the inconceivable dharmas of the buddhas, their mind is not frightened;
hearing the inconceivability of all buddhas, their mind is not frightened;
hearing the inconceivability of sentient beings, their mind is not frightened;
hearing the inconceivability of the dharma realm, their mind is not frightened;
Hearing that the realm of space is inconceivable, their minds are not frightened;

Hearing that the realm of nirvana is inconceivable, their minds are not frightened;ğŸ”½Hearing that the past is inconceivable, their minds are not frightened;ğŸ”½Hearing that the future is inconceivable, their minds are not frightened;
Hearing that the present is inconceivable, their minds are not frightened;
Hearing that entering all kalpas is inconceivable, their minds are not frightened.
Why is this?
Because bodhisattvas have single-minded, firm faith in the buddhas that cannot be destroyed. The buddhas know that the buddhas' wisdom is inexhaustible and boundless.
In the worlds of the ten directions, in each world, the buddhas of the three times, immeasurable and innumerable, appear in the world, perform the buddhas' work, and enter parinirvÄá¹‡a.

The wisdom of those Buddhas does not increase or decrease, is unborn and unceasing, does not end or depart, is neither near nor far, neither knowing nor confused. Bodhisattvas who accomplish such boundless and inexhaustible faith treasuries are then able to ride the TathÄgata's vehicle.

This bodhisattva accomplishes such immeasurable and boundless faith, irreversible faith, unconfused faith, indestructible faith, unattached faith, rooted faith, faith in accordance with the sages, and the nature of the TathÄgata's family. He is then able to uphold all the Buddha's teachings, nurture all bodhisattvas' wholesome roots, accord with all TathÄgatas' wholesome roots, and be born from all Buddhas' skillful means. This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's inexhaustible faith treasury.
Bodhisattvas dwelling in this faith treasury are able to hear and uphold the teachings of all TathÄgatas and extensively expound them for all sentient beings.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's treasury of precepts?

This bodhisattva attains the precepts of benefiting others, the precepts of non-acceptance, the precepts of non-attachment, the precepts of abiding, the precepts of non-dispute, the precepts of non-harming, the precepts of non-mixture, the precepts of leaving wrong livelihood, the precepts of leaving evil precepts, and the precepts of purity.
What are the precepts of benefiting others?
This bodhisattva should first benefit and bring happiness to sentient beings.
What are the precepts of non-acceptance?
This bodhisattva does not accept the precepts of non-Buddhists, and fully upholds the pure precepts that are equal in the three times of all Buddhas.
What are the precepts of non-attachment?
This bodhisattva is not attached to the precepts of the desire realm, not attached to the precepts of the form realm, and not attached to the precepts of the formless realm;
Why is it so?
Because they do not turn towards those realms.
What are the precepts of abiding?
This bodhisattva attains the precepts of purity without doubt or remorse;
Why is it so?
Because the bodhisattva does not commit the five heinous crimes, and never intentionally violates any precepts.
What are the precepts of non-dispute?
This bodhisattva does not violate the precepts set forth earlier, nor does he create new ones. His mind always accords with and moves towards the precepts of nirvana;

He fully observes them without any violation. He does not trouble sentient beings by these precepts, nor does he engage in mutual conflict. The bodhisattva observes the precepts only to benefit sentient beings and bring them joy.
What is the precept of non-harming?
This bodhisattva does not, because of observing the precepts, study various spells and herbs to harm sentient beings;
Why is it so?
Because the bodhisattva wishes to protect sentient beings, he observes the pure precepts.
What is the precept of non-mixture?

This bodhisattva is free from the views of annihilationism and eternalism, and does not observe the precepts in a mixed way. He only observes the twelve links of dependent origination and observes the precepts purely.
What is the precept of avoiding wrong livelihood?

This bodhisattva does not create the appearance of observing pure precepts in order to make others know that he has true virtues within, but actually lacks them. He only observes the pure precepts, single-mindedly seeks the Dharma, and ultimately attains omniscience.
What is meant by not violating precepts?
This bodhisattva does not boast, saying, I uphold precepts, and does not despise or scold those who violate precepts, causing them distress. He simply unifies his mind and upholds pure precepts.
What is meant by pure precepts?

This bodhisattva abandons killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, harsh speech, coarse words, divisive speech, frivolous speech, greed, anger, and wrong views, and fully upholds the ten wholesome deeds.
When this bodhisattva upholds such pure precepts, he thinks like this:

If there are sentient beings who violate pure precepts, it is due to the various afflictions of inverted thinking. All Buddhas fully discern that all these sentient beings violate pure precepts due to inverted thinking;

Therefore, I should single-mindedly seek the Buddha's path, ultimately attaining supreme enlightenment, and extensively expound the true Dharma for sentient beings, enabling them to abandon delusions, purely uphold the precepts, and ultimately attain supreme enlightenment.'
This is the second inexhaustible precept treasury of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's treasury of shame?
This bodhisattva recollects his past lives:

For countless eons, he has engaged in shameless conduct towards his six relations, either being disrespectful or licentious and unrestrained, enduring harm without regard for kin, raising armies to attack each other, deluded and inverted, committing all kinds of evil, due to the three poisons and wrong views, entangled in falsehood and flattery, and all kinds of unwholesomeness;
All sentient beings are also like this, all accumulating and habituating in shameless conduct, due to lack of wisdom up to flattery;

The noble and humble lose their proper order, do not respect and obey each other, cannot be humble, follow and serve the wise, always harbor poisonous thoughts, harbor grudges and resentment, and kill each other without shame or fear.

Reflecting on myself and other sentient beings, the practice of shamelessness in the past, present, and future, the Buddhas of the three times know and see all, how can I still practice shamelessness?
It is utterly unacceptable!

Therefore, I should cultivate the Dharma of shame, ultimately attain enlightenment, and widely expound the true Dharma for sentient beings, enabling them to forever part with all shameless dharmas and accomplish enlightenment.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's third inexhaustible treasury of shame.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's treasury of conscience?
This bodhisattva is ashamed of himself:

In the past, I greedily sought forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, dharmas, wives, children, relatives, money, property, servants, vehicles, and so forth, without being content. I should not engage in these unlawful activities, which give rise to greed, anger, and delusion, up to flattery.
He further thought like this:

'The shameless dharmas practiced by sentient beings are all due to ignorance, up to flattery, and various evil dharmas. Therefore, they do not mutually respect, honor, and make offerings to each other. They always harbor poisonous thoughts and harm each other.

I and sentient beings, in the past, present, and future, love and greedily seek to accumulate and practice these dharmas. Due to these dharmas, we experience rebirth in the womb and immeasurable suffering. The Buddhas of the three times all know and see this. If I still practice these shameless dharmas, the Buddhas of the three times will all be displeased;
I should cultivate the Dharma of shame and reach the ultimate bodhi, widely expounding this Dharma for sentient beings, enabling them to leave behind shamelessness and accomplish the Buddha's path.'
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's fourth inexhaustible treasury of shame.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's treasury of much learning?
This bodhisattva's much learning is as follows:
Knowing that because this thing exists, that thing exists; because this thing does not exist, that thing does not exist;
Because this thing arises, that thing arises; because this thing ceases, that thing ceases;

This is a worldly dharma, this is a supramundane dharma, this is a conditioned dharma, this is an unconditioned dharma, this is a dharma with karmic retribution, this is a dharma without karmic retribution.
What is meant by 'because this thing exists, that thing exists'?
It is as follows:
Because there is ignorance, there are karmic formations.
What is meant by 'because this thing does not exist, that thing does not exist'?
It is as follows:
Because there is no consciousness, there is no name-and-form.
What is meant by 'this thing arises because that thing arises'?
Namely:
Because craving arises, suffering arises.
What is meant by 'this thing ceases because that thing ceases'?
Namely:
Because existence ceases, birth and death cease.

Form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

Namely:
The body of precepts, the body of concentration, the body of wisdom, the body of liberation, and the body of the knowledge and vision of liberation.
What are conditioned dharmas?
Namely:
The desire realm, the form realm, the formless realm, and the realm of sentient beings.
What are unconditioned dharmas?
Namely:
Space, nirvana, cessation through contemplation, cessation without contemplation, the twelve links of dependent arising, and the dharma realm.
